snippet: Lawsuits questioning every merger deal seem to impose high costs on the companies involved and their shareholders while offering questionable benefits.
abstract: Lawsuits questioning every merger deal seem to impose high costs on the companies involved and their shareholders while offering questionable benefits.

byline.original: By ROBERT M. DAINES and OLGA KOUMRIAN

headline.main: Merger Lawsuits Yield High Costs and Questionable Benefits
